data.markup:
Student housing is available either through the studierendenwerk or through private companies. This can take the form of one-room apartments, flat shares, or dorm-style housing with a shared kitchen and bathrooms per floor.

Student housing is only available to students enrolled in a higher education institution.
data.raw_text: Student housing is available either through the studierendenwerk or through private companies. This can take the form of one-room apartments, flat shares, or dorm-style housing with a shared kitchen and bathrooms per floor. Student housing is only available to students enrolled in a higher education institution.

data.markup:
Flat shares are made up of two or more individuals who pool resources to rent an apartment or house together.

Flat-shares generally fall into two categories: "Zweck-WG"s where individuals are only interested in reducing the cost of rent and flat-shares where a social component is also desired and flatmates hangout and spend time together.
data.raw_text: Flat shares are made up of two or more individuals who pool resources to rent an apartment or house together. data.markup:
You can fill out the application form at home, but you must submit it in person at any one of the registration offiices in the city.

You can find a list of offices and a projection of the current waiting time here.

data.markup:
You will need the following to register your address:

  • The filled out registration form

  • A form confirming you have moved in, signed by your landlady or landlord called a [Wohnungsgeber-Bescheinigung] OR your moving-in letter [Einzugsschreiben] from the student ministry if you live in student housing

  • Your ID card or passport
data.raw_text:
You will need the following to register your address: 
 The filled out registration form 
 A form confirming you have moved in, signed by your landlady or landlord called a [Wohnungsgeber-Bescheinigung] OR your moving-in letter [Einzugsschreiben] from the student ministry if you live in student housing 
 Your ID card or passport

data.markup:
You must re-register every time you move!

Additionally, non-EU citizens who need to apply for a residence permit can only do so at the city where they are currently registered. So make sure if you change cities, you don't delay registering your new address.
data.raw_text:
You must re-register every time you move!
 Additionally, non-EU citizens who need to apply for a residence permit can only do so at the city where they are currently registered. So make sure if you change cities, you don't delay registering your new address.

data.markup:
Do not forget to fill in your SEPA direct debit authorization [SEPA-Lastschrift] and hand it in to the caretaker 's office in person (or send it by e-mail to your person responsible at the SWS)!

You should have received the SEPA form together with your tenancy agreement. With the SEPA authorization your monthly rent can be debited automatically from your bank account.

data.markup: For students moving into a dormitory of SWS, it is possible to have someone collect your room keys before arrival if you will have trouble making it to the office hours. To do this, you will need to arrange an appointment with the appropriate building caretaker (at best 14 days in advance) and you will need to send this person a filled out version of the authorisation form you received with you offer letter.
data.raw_text: For students moving into a dormitory of SWS, it is possible to have someone collect your room keys before arrival if you will have trouble making it to the office hours. To do this, you will need to arrange an appointment with the appropriate building caretaker (at best 14 days in advance) and you will need to send this person a filled out version of the authorisation form you received with you offer letter.

data.markup: You only have the option to pick up your dorm key in person (it is not possible to have someone collect your room key before your arrival). But you can arrange with the caretaker of the VSSW that they deposit your key in a safe in front of the dorm.

data.markup: If you plan to travel oustide the SSB/VVS network, you should look into the Deutschland ticket, which allows you unlimited use of regional transit across all of Germany. The ticket costs 49 euros per month. For more information please see the SSB website.

data.markup:
As a student, you are eligible for the SSB Semestermark which allows you use of regional transportation within the VVS/SSB network on weekends and after 6pm during the week.

You may also consider applying for the StudiTicket, which allows unlimited use of the VVS/SSB network and costs 210 euros per semester.

data.markup: You'll need to get in touch with any German state health insurance provider and notify them that you are covered by a social security agreement with your home country. As the next step the German provider needs to transmit this information electronically to the University of Stuttgart. Only then can you be enrolled.

data.markup:
You can open a personal current account in person at either a local bank or an online bank [Direktbank].

It is usually quicker to open a bank account at an online bank, however, they only offer online or hotline support, whereas, at a local bank, you will have immediate support in person if you experience problems.
data.raw_text:
You can open a personal current account in person at either a local bank or an online bank [Direktbank]. 
 It is usually quicker to open a bank account at an online bank, however, they only offer online or hotline support, whereas, at a local bank, you will have immediate support in person if you experience problems.

data.markup:
The following documents are required:

  • Proof of your address registration
  • Passport or identity card (EU-citizens)
  • Letter of admission from the University of Stuttgart (in order to get a student bank account)
  • University enrollment certificate (can be provided later)
  • Non-EU citizens: Visa or residence permit (can be provided later)

data.markup: However, the visa/residence permit of non-EU students only allows the employment as a student assistant. Therefore, non-EU students need to request an addition to their visa/residence permit when they are offered a position as a research assistant at the university. The addition is requested from the foreign registration office [Ausländerbehörde].
data.raw_text: However, the visa/residence permit of non-EU students only allows the employment as a student assistant. Therefore, non-EU students need to request an addition to their visa/residence permit when they are offered a position as a research assistant at the university. The addition is requested from the foreign registration office [Ausländerbehörde].

data.markup: Each semester the university sports [Hochschulsport] offers a large range of sports activities. There are special registration periods. To gain one of the popular places, you have to register as soon as possible. Further information infomation please visit the website.

data.markup: Payment for university sports classes is done online through a bank transfer, therefore you will need an EU bank account to take part in a sports class.

data.markup: Please submit all requested documents electronically to the C@MPUS website and transfer the semester contribution to the university. Once you have uploaded all documents, it can take up to three weeks to process your enrollment, so please make sure to do this before the start of the semester.
data.raw_text: Please submit all requested documents electronically to the C@MPUS website and transfer the semester contribution to the university. Once you have uploaded all documents, it can take up to three weeks to process your enrollment, so please make sure to do this before the start of the semester.

data.markup: Before submitting your enrolment application, make sure your health insurance status is listed correctly! If not, please contact your state health insurance provider! If you don not have a health insurance policy, please contact any provider. Health insurance is required to enroll in the university.
data.raw_text: Before submitting your enrolment application, make sure your health insurance status is listed correctly! If not, please contact your state health insurance provider! answers.raw_text: how do I know if I need one?

data.markup: Citizens from, for example, Australia, Brazil, Canada, Japan, South Korea, UK and the USA may enter Germany without a visa. Otherwise please check with your local embassy.
data.raw_text: Citizens from, for example, Australia, Brazil, Canada, Japan, South Korea, UK and the USA may enter Germany without a visa. Otherwise please check with your local embassy.

questions.text: Do I need a visa to enter the country?
What countries can enter Germany without a visa?
How do I know if I need a visa to enter the country?

data.markup: You will need to apply in advance for your entrance visa before you are allowed to enter the country. As a note, you will need to apply for a residence permit at the latest one week before your entrance visa expires.
data.raw_text: You will need to apply in advance for your entrance visa before you are allowed to enter the country. As a note, you will need to apply for a residence permit at the latest one week before your entrance visa expires.

questions.text: Can I apply for a visa after entering the country?
Do I need a visa before I can enter Germany?
When do I need to apply for a residence permit?

data.markup: Although you are allowed to enter Germany without a visa, you will need to apply for a residence permit at your place of residence upon arrival.
data.raw_text: Although you are allowed to enter Germany without a visa, you will need to apply for a residence permit at your place of residence upon arrival.

questions.text: Do I need a visa to enter Germany?
Do I need a residence permit?
Can I apply for a residence permit after entering the country?

data.markup: You need to apply for your residence permit at the foreigners ' registration office at the place of your registered residence.
data.raw_text: You need to apply for your residence permit at the foreigners ' registration office at the place of your registered residence.

questions.text: Where can I apply for a residence permit?
Can I apply for a residence permit at any foreigner's bureau?

data.markup: The production of your residence permit takes about eight weeks. When applying for your residence permit, the foreigners ' registration office will let you know when you will receive it. Meanwhile the foreigners ' registration office provides a preliminary confirmation of an authorized residence permit. The residence permit usually consists of a chip card and the supplementary sheet.
data.raw_text: The production of your residence permit takes about eight weeks. The residence permit usually consists of a chip card and the supplementary sheet.

data.markup: If you want to buy tickts at a later point, you can do this either in person, using a ticket machine at the station of your departure or online through the DB or VVS transportation apps.
